intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. affine, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its small, spurred flowers and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms from June to August. The species is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
